metadata.Description: The stages involved in the development and implementation of an energy project.

entities.Description: Markets where electricity, natural gas, and other energy commodities are bought and sold.
Agencies that promote and support the development and use of renewable energy sources.
The stages involved in the development and implementation of an energy project.
The use of less energy to provide the same level of output or service, resulting in reduced energy consumption, cost savings, and environmental benefits.
The process of capturing and storing energy for later use.

relations.Description: The energy project cycle implements the Energy Efficiency Policy to ensure energy-saving practices are followed.

relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency employs energy audits to identify energy-saving opportunities and optimize energy use.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies employ experts in the field of renewable energy to drive innovation and promote the adoption of clean energy technologies.

relations.Subject: renewable energy agencies
relations.Description: Renewable energy agencies collaborate with research institutions to advance scientific knowledge and develop new technologies for renewable energy generation.

relations.Subject: energy poverty indices
relations.Description: Energy poverty indices implement energy access programs to provide affordable and reliable energy services to underserved communities.

relations.Subject: energy poverty indices
relations.Description: Energy poverty indices fund renewable energy projects to increase access to clean and sustainable energy sources.

relations.Subject: energy storage
relations.Description: Energy storage addresses the issue of intermittency in renewable energy sources by storing excess energy for use during periods of low generation.

relations.Subject: energy markets
relations.Description: Energy markets address the issue of energy access by ensuring the availability and affordability of energy sources for all segments of society.

relations.Subject: renewable energy certificates
relations.Description: Renewable energy certificates are implemented by the Energy Efficiency Policy to promote the use of renewable energy sources.

relations.Subject: energy efficiency
relations.Description: Energy efficiency measures address energy waste by promoting the use of energy-efficient technologies and practices.

Project identification is the initial phase of the energy project cycle, where potential projects are identified based on the energy needs and priorities of a specific region or community. This phase involves conducting feasibility studies, assessing the technical and economic viability of the project, and identifying potential stakeholders and partners.
relations.Subject: project identification

relations.Description: Project preparation is the phase of the energy project cycle where detailed planning and preparation activities are carried out. This includes developing a project design, conducting environmental and social impact assessments, securing necessary permits and approvals, and preparing a detailed project implementation plan.
relations.Subject: project preparation

relations.Description: Project implementation is the phase of the energy project cycle where the actual construction, installation, and operation of the energy project take place. This phase involves procuring equipment and materials, hiring contractors and workers, managing project timelines and budgets, and ensuring compliance with relevant regulations and standards.
relations.Subject: project implementation

relations.Description: Project evaluation is the phase of the energy project cycle where the performance and impact of the completed project are assessed. This includes monitoring the project's energy generation or savings, evaluating its environmental and social outcomes, and analyzing its financial and economic viability. The findings from the evaluation are used to improve future project designs and inform decision-making.
relations.Subject: project evaluation

relations.Description: Project closure is the final phase of the energy project cycle, where the project is formally closed and handed over to the relevant stakeholders or operators. This phase involves conducting final inspections, preparing project completion reports, addressing any outstanding issues or obligations, and transitioning the project to its long-term operation and maintenance phase.
relations.Subject: project closure
